comments.commentBody:
Totally agree with above!
I was suprized that David Brooks calls Ryan an intellectual? Someone who lives in the Ayn Rand world, a fantasy world for teenagers, a third rate writer!

Is this what Brooks called an intellectual???
Brooks said: “Ryan believes Obama is European Socialist>..”
Ryan has the intellect of a silly middle-school teenager, living in fantasy-world!

As Thomas Friedman just said European Socialism is what we have now in the medical care: If I get sick and have no health insurance, I go to the emergency room and the cost of my treatment will be distributed among all the people who paid for health insurance (their insirance fees will go up).
What Obamacare dod is Capitalist Health Care: everybody pays.

What's in it that Ryan doesn't understand or misconstrued?
You certainly got your data because terrorists' answer Gallop surveys, Right?

Why don't you tell us, Ed?
What would you do differently, in Afghanistan?

What is your take on Ryan's not enlisting to 'defend our way of life'?
What are Mitt's qualifications as a future commander in chief?
Could his religious views on war be a hindrance?

Considered a political strength... Obama's scores of drone strikes that took out terrorists.

So why is al Qaeda affiliates (terrorists) growing in numbers since Obama took office?

Yes, and the Chinese-made Dansko clogs have slick artifical insoles which cause your feet to slip out of them. The old Danskos had beautiful leather insoles which hugged your feet. That's just one of the quality factors that went South when production went East. The Dansko shoe pictured is not technically a clog, since it has a back - so it should hold your foot well. I don't agree with the quoted stewardess that they're "hideous;" many Danskos are beautiful.
Yes! Agreed. Those are the best. I have a pair of oxblood ballet flats with nike air. I wore them all over Paris and London and on the plane to and fro. They are pricey, but worth every penny.
Cole Haan with Nike Air technology!

Also, animal studies like this cannot provide the data the researchers want: often animals respond quite differently to a similar situation when people are put in it. In short: yeah, animal research is a total waste.
Before I worry about this, I would like to see a SPCH where H stands for humans.
This is disgusting for its torture of innocent, sentient creatures and for its waste of time and money. Hey, politicians looking to for things to cut from the budget: Look over here.
Why have them ask?  Let's just cut them off as they deserve.

Rick Santorum couldn't stand on his own two feet during that interview. It was embarrassing to listen to him stammer as he tried to respond to the most simplistic of questions.  Off script, on live TV, he was inarticulate and vapid. How can anyone believe this man represents  presidential material?

When Santorum is asked a question he has no answer to he simply reverts to a stock speech. It isn't in a politician to say, "I don't know".

If their lips are moving....
Janet, how could Snatorum say anything "substantial" about Romney?  He is totally composed of Smoke and Mirrors.

Rick Santorum is another example of a Republican who isn't in love with Mitt Romney.  In his interview on Wednesday night with the PBS Newshour team at the convention he hesitated and tried to avoid saying anything substantial when asked to give an example of Mr. Romney's humanness.  The best he could come up with was something about small talk backstage before the primaries.  Mr. Santorum is still holding a big grudge, it seems to me.  Admitting that he still wants to run for president someday, Santorum used this PBS interview to point out all his conservative creditials rather than cheerleading for Romney.
Prayers won't help them.  Federal government assistance will, but many of them including their governor like to bite the hand that feeds them and gives them shelter when they need it.

If you live on the coast, you're used to storms. You rarely know which will be bad enough to have to evacuate, and this one did not seem to be. You can't leave your house, your farm animals, and pay a bundle for hotel rooms every time a significant storm comes by.

It's past time that the U.S. started looking at what Holland's done and applying it here. The alternative is losing a significant portion of the country.

"Gov. Bobby Jindal of Louisiana said Wednesday that more than 4,000 people were in shelters across the state, and that 5,000 members of the National Guard had been deployed to help in response efforts."

Wait a minute! I thought Jindal didn't believe in government helping those in need? I am sick and tired of paying taxes to help those who don't believe in helping others. The hypocrisy needs to stop. If you don't believe in government helping others, than don't come looking for help when you need it. Fend for yourself as you feel others should have to.

Dear Ron, what part of the U.S. would you consider out of a danger zone?  Be sure to take into account not only hurricanes, but earthquakes, mudslides, tornadoes, derechos, forest fires, tsunamis, volcanoes, and flooding.

West Michigan, where I live, although a generally rather conservative and intolerant place, will continue the trend this year to vote for the Democratic presidential candidate, as it has done every single time since 1988. Obama will win here once again to continue that solid history.

I've made polling calls in this part of the state myself, and there is considerable enthusiasm for President Obama while there little enthusiasm for the effete, horse-dancing, anti-middle-class, pro-hate Willard.
This is such an original idea! And a really good way to create a lasting identity for the product :)
I love her style and the colors are beautiful!
Breathtakingly beautiful. I'd also love to order a catalogue.
If you're going to hike, wear hiking boots. Keen makes some great ones that look chunky but are very lightweight although sturdy.
@Nancy, Oak Ridge: assume all photos are 'shopped. That said, the stewardess' head may appear larger because she's leaning forward and her head is closer to the viewer than the rest of her body.
MN - I just checked some life insurance tables dated 1958, and at 5'9" with shoes even a small-framed man is considered underweight at 135.
Tender and beautiful story. You´ll love the characters brilliantly performed,
Your comment was hilarious!  I love it!  I will have to check this guy out.  He seems like an oxymoron, fitness and foody, but he has really piqued my interest.

Even if you don't enjoy cooking shows, turn on Restaurant Impossible, put on the mute, and gaze at Robert Irvine's superb thighs in his blue jeans and his magnificent  biceps in his black t-shirt. Those images feed my soul. I'm 80 but such glorious male energy makes me feel like a teenager again.

comments.commentTitle: Jake is the best thing in this mess
comments.commentBody: I was not really a huge fan of Jake Gyellthaal, or at least I didn't go to just to see him in this play.  The only thing I have seen  him in is Brokeback, and he was pretty good in that.  I must admit, I don't see too many movies.  I do see ALOT of theatre.  I found him to be very charming and intriguing on stage!  He is also believable and gives a really, really wonderful performance.  The girl who plays his niece also gives a wonderful, brave performance.  He name is Anne Funke.  The other two actors are very competent as well. The problem is the play is an utter mess. I may not always like a play but I can get into it. When I am really bored, I know there is a problem. What bigger gauge is there? I was pretty bored during most of this. There is some very clever technical wizardry going on. I almost don't want to give it away.  Let's just say they are sloshing around in water for the last quarter of the play as well as their curtain call. Jake could have picked ANY play he wanted to and it would have been produced.  I have no idea what he saw in this play. This is just a boring, uninteresting study of four dysfunctional people. Nothing new, nothing we haven't seen before done better. But I say Bravo to Jake! And Bravo to Anne Funke.  I look forward to seeing him again on stage in a better play. He is a great talent and deserves better.

Having sat through, the previous night, an overmiked, mushy, difficult to hear Porgy and Bess, which received good reviews, I was so happy to see this Into the Woods which, although not perfect, was wonderfully entertaining and stirring. I didn't particularly appreciate  the original Into the Woods but the shift in the Narrator works, in my view. Staging was a problem, to be sure. Why not use the whole stage instead of the middle (I sat Stage Left)? In a year of horrible  musical productions and not much more serious drama, I have a hard time understanding  Mr. Brantley's poor review.

High energy, fast pace, olympic  level gymnastics, dance, and hilarious social commentary set to rockin' music. This is a totally entertaining show start to finish.  I enjoyed it thoroughly. How often do you walk out of a show feeling uplifted and smiling at the world.

What about the leadership in Libya whose former leader was the #2 terrorist killer of Americans?.  Syria a little different.   The reluctance to get involved is smart.  First it's in the Turks backyard.  They wan't to join the EU and be leaders than they have to commit.  Until the rebels and the Turks can carve out a zone under rebel control there isn't much point.   Secondly there is no clear tactical solution that we can employ since the rebels are fighting a guerrilla war.  Thirdly our friends the Russians have a naval base there and are opposed to direct involvement.  It would be pointless to get into a dustup with the Russians.

There aren't even a thousand Al Quaeda in the entire world so don't worry about them. The Assads have shown no respect for anyone other than their cronies and have attacked our ally Israel on numerous occasions. They also support Hezbollah which by any definition are Jihadis.

A pox on all their houses.
